article_title: Ted Cruz tells state Republicans not to lose hope
article_text:
Ted Cruz tells state Republicans not to lose hope

Photo: Rodger Mallison, MBR / TNS Delegates cheer as Sen. Ted Cruz speaks at the Republican Party of...

DALLAS — In his first home-state appearance since leaving the presidential race, U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz told supporters at the Texas GOP convention Saturday not to lose hope in the face of uncertain times.

article_metadata.description: DALLAS — In his first home-state appearance since leaving the presidential race, U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz told supporters at the Texas GOP convention Saturday not to lose hope in the face of uncertain times.  The 20-minute speech, welcomed with a standing ovation, became a sort of seminar on what it means to be conservative, tailored to his Texas supporters who consistently throughout the convention voiced concern about Trump’s values.  Some party members here have pledged to stay home if Trump locks down the nomination, and others said they would vote Libertarian.  Most said they would hold their noses and vote Trump for the sake of party loyalty, though they worried what his potential White House tenure could entail.  Cruz recognized the tens of thousands of Texas volunteers who pushed his campaign, and the 12,000 in particular who traveled cross-country with the “Texas strike force” in an unprecedented mobilization of grass-roots activism.
article_metadata.author.name: By Dylan Baddour, Houston Chronicle
